node.data: {"banner":{"githubBtn":"STAR ON GITHUB","docsBtn":"DOCUMENTATION"},"emailSubscribe":{"caption":"Stay tuned, subscribe to our news!","emailPlaceholder":"email address","sendBtn":"Subscribe"},"features":{"1":{"title":"Open-source","content":"DockOvpn's source code is avialable on <1>GitHub</1> and is reviewed and maintained by cyber-security specialists from all over the world."},"2":{"title":"Dockerized","content":"DockOvpn is shipped as a docker image, which means it can be deployed virtually everywhere.<1></1><2>Learn more</2>"},"3":{"title":"Blazingly fast","content":"It takes as little as 2 seconds for DockOvpn to start up and and be ready to accept hundreds simultaneous connections."},"main":"DockOvpn â€” is an out of the box dockerized OpenVPN server, which starts in just a few seconds and runs forever."},"quickStart":{"1":"To get it running, just copy and paste this code snippet in you server's terminal and follow on-screen instructions.","2":"Observe the following or similiar output and be ready to download configuration when asked to do so.","3":{"main":"Once server started and fully initialized (normally shouldn't take longer than 2 sec), you can download <1>client.ovpn</1> configuration.","note":"(For more secure options of transferring config file, check our <1>Documentation</1>)"},"4":"Use this configuration with any of the available OpenVPN clients for your platform. See table below for more information."},"clients":"Available clients"}
